intro: Mesembryanthemum linguiforme subsp. obliquum, commonly known as the oblique leaf ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. This subspecies is closely related to other members of the Aizoaceae family, known for their adaptability to arid environments.
